title: howcome i never see kled... or gnar... or like 3/4s of the champ roster in general
body:
Seriously, it's always pickings of 15-20meta champs (Ok mayyybe 30), and the same old 1 tricks (Yas/riven/etc)

then like... 100 or so more champs just collect dust, some are just waiting for their meta, but most are just... outshined

weak, unsynergistic with the items.

replies.body:
"How come I never see Kled?"

Because you're lucky.
Really lucky at that.
Or, like in my case, Bronze.
Honestly you hear him coming first, he never freaking shuts up.

It's because everyone wants to be like their favorite pros and the general mindset.  I had a game where mid wanted to play Heimerdinger and the Jungler was like "Can you not... play heimer, the worst ap mid in the game?"  I've had games where I pick Aatrox Top lane and see someone say "Aatrox....? he's not good gg we lose"

People are shamed out of playing anything different in Ranked because of the belief that "those other champs are for normals" or "Don't play this champ in low elo"  Especially when some people consider anything under high Diamond to be low elo.  That's like 90% of the playerbase.

> [{quoted}](name=Choten,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-05-09T01:20:14.512+0000)
>
> It's because everyone wants to be like their favorite pros and the general mindset.  I had a game where mid wanted to play Heimerdinger and the Jungler was like "Can you not... play heimer, the worst ap mid in the game?"  I've had games where I pick Aatrox Top lane and see someone say "Aatrox....? he's not good gg we lose"
> 
> People are shamed out of playing anything different in Ranked because of the belief that "those other champs are for normals" or "Don't play this champ in low elo"  Especially when some people consider anything under high Diamond to be low elo.  That's like 90% of the playerbase.

Funny how i had an aatrox 1v5 my team AND WIN a few days ago and ppl have said hes not good.

> [{quoted}](name=JamesTheMage15,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-05-09T01:41:40.333+0000)
>
> Funny how i had an aatrox 1v5 my team AND WIN a few days ago and ppl have said hes not good.

Aatrox isn't good, your team was bad
Yeah, anyone can 1v5 if theyre far enough ahead.

> [{quoted}](name=Mig89,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-09T18:00:12.887+0000)
>
> Yeah, anyone can 1v5 if theyre far enough ahead.

Not really?
My statement is absolutely true

> [{quoted}](name=Mig89,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-09T21:04:13.579+0000)
>
> My statement is absolutely true

Maybe outplaying champs like yas, but not burst mages like veigar who kill one person then runs.
Far ahead ENOUGH. Basically enough means end all, be all so even full ad lvl 18 braum can 1v5 5 level ones, not totally realistic, but you get the point.
just give him a ton of attack speed and some lifesteal.  EZPZ.

Braum top OP kappa.
Seriously though i was talking extremes. Veigar absolutely could one shot if he is fed enough with only his Q. Yes its an extreme example but its true none the less. A full tank nunu with Titanic would 1v5. It all depends on how boosted the enemy team is lol

Aatrox is good atm... even if it dosnt excuse the 1v5 (yeah his team was bad).
But Aatrox isnt weak like a few patch ago, WAKE UP.
Stop whining please. You think anyone's broken the moment they beat you even once regardless of other context.

> [{quoted}](name=Choten,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-05-09T01:20:14.512+0000)
>
> It's because everyone wants to be like their favorite pros and the general mindset.  I had a game where mid wanted to play Heimerdinger and the Jungler was like "Can you not... play heimer, the worst ap mid in the game?"  I've had games where I pick Aatrox Top lane and see someone say "Aatrox....? he's not good gg we lose"
> 
> People are shamed out of playing anything different in Ranked because of the belief that "those other champs are for normals" or "Don't play this champ in low elo"  Especially when some people consider anything under high Diamond to be low elo.  That's like 90% of the playerbase.

I hate it when people pick offmeta or unpopular picks. Usually it means that they know what they're doing and will stomp us. One of the worst beatings I ever got as a support was against a J4 support.
I don't think I've seen a {{champion:421}} in any of my games this year.

Where is {{champion:78}} 
I have seen more {{champion:9}} than poppy this season.
I just realized I haven't seen a Volibear in over a year...
Heh, I've been spamming him lately. He gets so underestimated. 1500 damage bear bites are fun.
{{champion:150}}  is my #1 used ranked champion at 50 games and 54% win. He makes me happy.

> [{quoted}](name=TaliyahToMaster,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2017-05-09T17:13:12.476+0000)
>
> Same with Taliyah for me.
> Althought I have almost 300 games on her 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

https://euw.op.gg/summoner/userName=taliyahtomaster
nice eu build
Frozen heart is god tier
Well when your Q has no CD anyways, who cares if you lose a bit of damage for 90 Armor 20% CDR while still doing DPS :^).

The armor and cdr are really good, but I also love the mana and the passive it has.

Since my Taliyah build with frozen heart is 
{{item:3102}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3116}} 
I'm really short on mana, so frozen heart comes in handy.
The passive is especially good against on hit champions and we all know they are really popular right now.
I only said ranked. I've 100k+ points on him

Kled is sleeper OP rn and most decent players know this already

He's been pretty strong for awhile now tbh
Thanks God, let him sleep.

Kled weak... HAHAHAHAHAHA!

As for the rest of this topic that would be like asking "Why do we have so many Soldiers and Scouts but no Pyros or Medics?" Because people play what they find fun. No matter how strong he is fewer people will enjoy Nunu over Ahri.

The funny thing is, is I find playing healers the best. I pretty much only play Mercy when I play Overwatch with a side of Mcree. Coincidentally, I played Medic and Spy in TF2. There's two problems with this in League. I hate Soraka and Ahri is the best.

I'd kill for Solders and Scouts.

Half my teams were usually composed of goddamn Snipers.

I couldn't shame my kind after all
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/dwmSeFqxnrE/hqdefault.jpg
Well thank god Gnar is gone

I see kled a fair amount, but i dont see gnar that much. I think its because of their really unique play style (Kled with skarl and Gnar with mega Gnar)

edit: I put skarner instead of skarl
What? I often see Kled.

They aren't really outshined, people don't want to appreciate what all those other champions do and so come up with a vague excuse to create a meta without much thought and just keep on doing that until pro players randomly decide that something else is good now.

Pros and other high level players don't "randomly decide" something else is good. They respond to changes patch to patch, play thousands of games to test what works well and what doesn't, and adapt team strategies accordingly. They don't just get tired of playing OP champs, they seek out the next OP champ based off of changes made to the game.

That said, I'm talking about players who, if they played an off-meta champ, would almost always lose, because they're competing against other players who would stomp them with stronger (meta) champs. At most elo levels, there's more leeway and players can be good/effective with any champ; or at least a large variety of champs. But you're right, a lot of people are meta slaves/only do what the pros say/do.

On a pro/high elo level - Yes there are champs that are just outshined by others

At lower-mid elo - Meta champions' power levels can be overcome more easily (because people playing those champs are probably only playing them because they saw Bjergsen playing them)

If you don't see a Kled it's because your elo isn't high enough to see a Kled. He's currently seeing play professionally, so he's played fairly frequently in solo queue. Of course, 7.9 might change that, but we'll see.
Got any Examples?

> [{quoted}](name=EzreaI x Lux,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-05-09T01:15:07.407+0000)
>
> Got any Examples?

Ive seen {{champion:30}}maybe like 1-2 times since 2016. (Excludng ARAM where you have no choice.)

He´s been gaining popularity though? Especially since some like Tobias fate streamed playing him. 

And a lot in Korea if i recall, he was played a lot there for a while and then gained a steady playerbase if i am not completely wrong. 


We're just slow and stagnant everywhere else generally.

> [{quoted}](name=Thefrostyviking,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2017-05-09T13:28:34.633+0000)

especially the top scripting {{champion:30}} that seems to dominate the top lane every few patches

> [{quoted}](name=NINJAWARRlOR99,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OM6gIUjW,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2017-05-09T17:21:57.590+0000)
>
> especially the top scripting {{champion:30}} that seems to dominate the top lane every few patches

Scripters appear everywhere at some point, i´ve seen Lee sin, Azir  and even an ezreal one not even long ago.

Well....the azir one might actually be quite a while ago but it's highly unusual to be able to walk out and dodge zac leap followed by ulti while also dodging a ziggs dropping bombs at the same time. That was a memorable event. 

As for the rarity of a champion having "support" from scrips....

If anything i think {{champion:96}}  are more common even outside Korea? 

Not to mention the Victor, syndra and the ever famous Xerath scripts. x)

{{champion:266}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:28}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:150}}{{champion:120}} {{champion:420}}

im not going to continue this list I'm just trying to illustrate a point here *edit* (It submitted for some reason >.<) 

I'm trying to illustrate a point that there are a lot of viable good picks in that small sample alone, and most of them are just ignored

now i'm just going to throw this out there, we fixate as a community on a smallish list of champions. but each meta shift tends to have issues, and by that i mean we usually just see the top four or five broken champs, then we see the champions that are equipped to handle those champs fairly easily, and then we see the always strongish generalist champs,

That list is a bit off. I see {{champion:3}} and {{champion:119}}  way too much. And {{champion:105}} is in permaban state right now in 90% of my games. I agree on some of them but that's because they just aren't really good right now. Anytime you have a game with 100+ champs it will be rare to see the ones that aren't considered OP at the time.

Is Fizz on your list of "ignored" because of his 49% ban rate? I wouldn't lump him in with Mundo, Eve, or Azir, considering he is op as shit right now, and picked or banned in almost every game I play.
